action.action-desc: Mr. Johnson of Georgia (for himself, Mr. Smith of New Jersey, Mr. Rangel, Ms. Clarke of New York, Ms. Norton, Ms. Brown of Florida, Mr. Fattah, and Mr. Rush) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To require the submission of a report to the Congress on parasitic disease among poor Americans.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Neglected Infections of Impoverished Americans Act of 2015.

section.header: Report to Congress on the current state of parasitic diseases that have been overlooked among the poorest Americans

subsection.text: Not later than 12 months after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Health and Human Services shall report to the Congress on the epidemiology of, impact of, and appropriate funding required to address neglected diseases of poverty, including neglected parasitic diseases such as—

paragraph.text: other related parasitic diseases, as designated by the Secretary.

subsection.text: The report under subsection (a) should provide the information necessary to guide future health policy to—

paragraph.text: accurately evaluate the current state of knowledge concerning diseases described in such subsection and define gaps in such knowledge; and
address the threat of such diseases.
